author: John Ferak
title: Victim Hit In Head With Wrench Goes To St. Joe's Hospital: Joliet PD
text:
[Crime & Safety](/illinois/joliet/police-fire)
Victim Hit In Head With Wrench Goes To St. Joe's Hospital: Joliet PD
Charles McIntosh, 72, confirmed to officers he struck the victim with the wrench, Joliet police announced.
JOLIET — A 72-year-old senior citizen was arrested and booked into the Will County Jail in connection with this week's violent attack involving a wrench inside a home in the 2600 block of Campbell Street, the Joliet police arrest reports show. The victim was taken to St. Joe's hospital, according to Joliet police.
Police indicated that Charles McIntosh was put in the county jail on charges of domestic battery.
The following events led to McIntosh's incarceration on Tuesday, according to Joliet police spokesman Dwayne English:
Find out what's happening in Jolietfor free with the latest updates from Patch.
At 12:57 a.m., the officers responded to a house in the 2600 block of Campbell Street for a domestic disturbance. On Campbell, the officers learned that McIntosh had attacked a 50-year-old man. It is believed that while at the house, McIntosh became involved in an argument with his victim and McIntosh picked up a wrench and struck the victim on the head, police noted.
McIntosh confirmed to the officers that he struck the victim with the wrench, and he was placed into custody without incident, English pointed out.
Find out what's happening in Jolietfor free with the latest updates from Patch.
The victim was taken to St Joseph Medical Center by the Joliet Fire Department ambulance for treatment of his injuries sustained in the attack, police indicated.
Jail records indicate McIntosh was released from the jail by Will County's judges on Wednesday. The defendant lives in downtown Joliet in the 0 to 50 block of East Clinton Street.

author: James Pilcher, WKRC
title: chevron-right
text:
UNION, Ky. (WKRC) — A tragic collision at the intersection of U.S. 42 and Beaver Road in Boone County on Tuesday has left two women dead and another critically injured.
The incident has reignited longstanding concerns about the safety of the intersection, which has been the site of numerous crashes over the years.
The crash occurred when a fully loaded Mack dump truck, carrying 80,000 pounds of cargo, collided with a Chevy Malibu turning onto the highway.
The impact killed 91-year-old Eva Mulberry of Williamstown, Kentucky, and 89-year-old Betty Hillard of Lexington, Kentucky. The driver of the Malibu, 66-year-old Rhonda Wright from Corinth, was hospitalized in critical condition with life-threatening injuries. The truck driver sustained minor injuries and was treated and released.
The dump truck also crashed into the Boonedocks Pub and Grub, causing damage but no injuries inside the establishment. Co-owner Melissa Schneider-Kroth expressed relief that no one inside was hurt but emphasized the need for changes at the intersection.
She noted that trucks carrying gravel from nearby quarries and gravel businesses routinely come down the hill and then need to go back up another hill through the intersection, with authorities also warning about low visibility when trying to turn onto the highway from Beaver Road.
"There are numerous crashes that have happen out here just since we've owned the building, and what does need to change isn't going to just be taking a stoplight because it is hard for those trucks to come down, or the speed limit needs to be lowered," Schneider-Kroth said.
Boone County Sheriff's spokesman Phillip Ridgell stated that initial investigations indicated that speed wasn't a factor in the crash.
He noted that there have been 24 collisions at this location over the past five years, with 14 resulting in injuries, though none were previously fatal. Crashes on U.S. 42 outside Florence account for 8.1% of all crashes in Boone County during that time.
"What else can the sheriff's office do to make that intersection safe?" Local 12 said.
"Yeah, so most simplistically, our visibility in the area. I fully suspect that cruisers, both marked and unmarked, will be seen," Ridgell said. "When you have something like this, it certainly warrants that. When a truck that is that large is going even the speed limit but coming down a hill, it needs significantly more space in order to apply the brakes before it comes to a complete stop or can safely avoid something in the roadway. There just wasn't enough space yesterday."
Any changes to the intersection would need to be approved by the Kentucky Transportation Cabinet (KYTC), and then it can only be done after an extensive traffic study.
KYTC declined to make anyone available for an interview. In a statement, the agency said:
"Yesterday’s crash is tragic, and our hearts go out to those involved and their loved ones. Team Kentucky prioritizes safety for all roadway users, and Transportation Cabinet staff routinely review crash data to guide safety improvements. The intersection of U.S. 42 and Beaver Road (KY 338) has been reviewed by engineers in the past, and multiple improvements were made, including the relocation of intersection warning beacons with reflective backplates to optimize visibility, oversized stop signs, clearing the right of way last summer to improve sight distance, and high-friction surface treatment on U.S. 42 that is shown to reduce wet crashes by 83% and total crashes by 57%, according to the Federal Highway Administration.
"A speed study was performed on U.S. 42, and the data indicated a 55 miles-per-hour speed is appropriate for this rural section of roadway. The Transportation Cabinet will continue to study future safety needs, including performing a traffic signal study that has been requested by Boone County Judge/Executive Gary W. Moore."
The owners of Boonedocks said that they don't know when they'll reopen but are thankful to area residents who have stepped up to help, including some bar regulars who have donated time and building materials to cover up and rebuild where the truck crashed into the building.

author: @infobae
title: El Gobierno ceutí denuncia al comentarista de TV3 que llamó "monos de Gibraltar" a aficionados de la AD Ceuta - Infobae
text: El Gobierno de Ceuta ha interpuesto este jueves una denuncia penal ante el Juzgado de Primera Instancia e Instrucción de la ciudad dirigida al programa 'Esport3' de TV3 y al comentarista que llegó a calificar "de monos" a la afición ceutí durante la retransmisión del encuentro entre el Club Gimnàstic de Tarragona y la Agrupación Deportiva Ceuta el pasado 9 de junio. Los calificativos fueron proferidos durante la pausa previa a la segunda parte del partido, cuando los comentaristas del programa deportivo de la televisión pública de Cataluña realizaron comentarios referidos a la actitud de los aficionados visitantes, de quienes llegaron a decir: "Ríete tú de los monos de Gibraltar". El presidente de la Ciudad, Juan Vivas, mantuvo una reunión dos días después del incidente, en la que se acordó interponer la denuncia por manifestaciones que son, a juicio del Ejecutivo, "constitutivas de un delito contra la integridad moral", además de considerarlas "absolutamente inadmisibles, de tinte xenófobo, racista y supremacista, que pretendían ridiculizar a todo un colectivo, incluso a toda una ciudad". Los términos utilizados fueron los siguientes: "En la grada de los ceutís hay lío, están bien los planos del córner subidos a la jaula. Si abre la jaula, ríete tú de los monos de Gibraltar". "Esta equiparación entre ceutíes y monos supone una manifestación pública de humillación, menosprecio y descrédito por motivos racistas", han insistido. La parte denunciada se limitó a pronunciarse a través de sus redes sociales dos días después de lo sucedido. Pidieron disculpas públicas por comentarios que reconocieron como "totalmente inadmisibles". "Pedimos disculpas a la afición y a los espectadores". La Real Federación de Fútbol de Ceuta (RFFCE) se sumó a las quejas vertidas por la Ciudad contra los comentarios. Horas antes de lo ocurrido durante la retransmisión del partido, la entidad manifestó su condena contra "los lamentables hechos" acaecidos durante la llegada de los jugadores de la AD Ceuta a Tarragona, cuando un grupo de aficionados del Nástic lanzó piedras contra las ventanas del autobús del equipo visitante.

author: sina.com.cn
title: 伟力得50MW/200MWh中帛源全钒液流储能项目建成投用|甘肃省_新浪财经_新浪网
text:
原标题：伟力得50MW/200MWh中帛源全钒液流储能项目建成投用 来源：铁合金在线
日前，山丹县乐北滩百万千瓦级光伏发电基地上，50MW/200MWh中帛源全钒液流储能项目建成投入使用，开启储电模式，200套集装箱、400个储液罐组成的大型“充电宝”矗立在光伏集阵中，为电网稳定运行注入新动力。
“全钒液流电池将不同价态的钒离子溶液分别储存在正、负储液罐中，电池充、放电时泵送电解液由正、负储液罐分别循环流经电池的正、负极室，两室间发生电子转移后完成在电极表面的氧化、还原反应，最终实现电池的充电放电。”四川伟力得能源股份有限公司自动化工程师孙发晔介绍，储能项目将富裕电量存储，到用电高峰再放出来，实现高效利用。
中帛源全钒液流储能项目是甘肃伟力得储能电池有限公司去年生产安装，今年2月完成调试的储能项目。“去年，我们还在阿拉善实施了5MW/20MWh全钒液流储能项目，现场安装40天，12月底完成，目前调试已进入尾声，即将进入商业运营模式。”甘肃伟力得储能电池有限公司副总经理马虎龙表示，成立于2022年8月的甘肃伟力得储能电池有限公司，是一家全钒液流储能系统研发、设计、生产、销售、服务于一体的生产制造企业，属四川伟力得能源股份有限公司的全资子公司。公司坚持以“用科技创新让电能储存更安全”为使命，在电池管理系统研发、自动化电堆制造、MW级光伏侧全钒液流电池储能电站建设运营、GW级全钒液流电池制造等方面发挥引领作用，实现技术突破与创新，快速服务及响应甘肃及周边新型电力系统储能需求，促进储能产业健康持续发展，为区域“双碳”目标贡献力量。去年，公司实现工业产值2.04亿元，解决就业岗位100多人。
在甘肃伟力得储能电池有限公司集成装配车间，工作人员忙着为下一个项目准备材料。“先粘接管路，制作盘管盒，1套储能系统需要粘接16节长度不相等的 PVC 管。经过盘管盒制作、模块组装、模块进箱、管路安装等十几道工序，完成1套储能系统，大概需要12个小时。”工作人员邹成红告诉记者，该公司生产的全钒液流储能系统主要用于电源侧、电网侧、大型客户端，销往新疆、内蒙古、陕西、宁夏等地。
近年来，山丹县紧紧围绕打造“3+3”产业链发展目标，做大做强煤炭生产集散及深加工、新能源及储能装备制造、新材料综合开发利用、生物医药、农畜产品精深加工、数字经济六大产业，投资2.48亿元在城北工业园区实施高新技术企业孵化园标准化厂房建设项目，建成集企业独立办公、生产组装于一体的轻型钢结构大容积高标准厂房24栋、综合办公楼两栋、公寓楼1栋，并配套其他附属设施，有效保障入驻企业生产、生活、办公需求。目前，孵化园已引进全钒液流储能电池、光伏支架、铝合金电缆、汽车充电桩、磷酸铁锂储能电池、汽车减震器等生产企业，较好地发挥了“筑巢引凤”作用，加快了招商引资项目的落地进程，在引领县域经济发展中取得了明显成效。
特别是在新能源产业发展中，山丹县全方位整合优势资源，立体式推进实施“集约化”“集聚化”“集群化”战略，引进甘肃伟力得全钒液流电池储能装备两条智能化电堆生产线，采用大功率液流电池电堆激光焊接封装、大规模储能单元控制、储能电站建设与运维等全面的系统集成技术，年产能达500MW，大大提升了“风”“光”能源的含金量。
第19届钒产业发展论坛暨钒电池储能大会，点击 第19届钒产业发展论坛暨钒电池储能大会 查看更多。
（转自：铁合金在线）
